subject: Philosophy
title: Moral Relativism
description: A quick, practical guide to Moral Relativism.

hook.text: In some cultures, arranged marriage is moral. In others, it's oppressive. Who's right?

buildup.text: Moral relativism says there are no universal truths. Right and wrong depend on culture or context.

discovery.text: The Greek historian Herodotus noticed different peoples had incompatible customs ‚Äî and each was certain.

twist.text: But if morality is relative, you can't condemn slavery or genocide. They were 'normal' somewhere.

climax.text: Most philosophers reject extreme relativism but accept that culture shapes moral intuitions.

punchline.text: If everything is relative, nothing is wrong.

quiz.question: What is the main problem with extreme moral relativism?
options: It makes it impossible to condemn any practice
It leads to too many rules
